verbs.description: outbrave (third-person singular simple present outbraves, present participle outbraving, simple past and past participle outbraved)

entries.meaning: To stand out bravely against; to face up to courageously.

examples: to outbrave one another, they will tire their bodies, macerate their souls, and through contentions or mutual invitations beggar themselves.

There, like one possessed,Outraving and outbraving all the rest,One Lycabas, from Tuscan city sentTo purge a deed of blood by banishment,As I withstood him, struck a breakneck blow,And would have dashed me to the waves below  […]
